intro: Lipocarpha rautanenii, commonly known as the slender bulrush, is a perennial aquatic plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically green or brown in color. It thrives in shallow freshwater environments such as marshes and wetlands. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
